intro: Cordia rangelensis, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or rangelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Boraginaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough or hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds.
